basics.name: David Ma
basics.summary: An undergraduate student interested in the intersection of biology, chemistry, environmental science and computation.

work.name: Argonne National Laboratory
work.summary: Part-time research aide working on the national AI flood mapping project. Developed python and shell scripts for dataset collection and devised a successful manual labeling workflow. Currently investigating different computer vision model architectures on the HPC clusters for predicting flood pixels from both multispectral and synthetic radar aperture (SAR) data.

work.name: Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center
work.summary: Cleaned and analyzed kinase inhibitor dataset, including measuring the polypharmacology of different FDA approved kinase inhibitors. Experimented with cheminformatic ML models (Chemprop, ProSmith) on HPC for predicting kinase inhibition profiles using chemical structure.

work.name: Argonne National Laboratory
work.summary: Conducted independent project modeling PFAS bioaccumulation over the course of 12 weeks. Explored different data sampling methodologies and transfer learning to predict bioaccumulation behavior in a small class of PFAS compounds.

volunteer.summary: Statistics instructor for the MAPSCorp program at Kenwood Academy and UC Woodlawn Charter School. Taught weekly 2 hour sessions over 18 weeks.

awards.title: Enrico Fermi Scholar in Physical Sciences
awards.summary: Awarded to students in the top 5% of their program of study.

awards.title: Robert Maynard Hutchins Scholar
awards.summary: Awarded to students in the top 10% of the class in their first two years of study.

awards.title: Deans List
awards.summary: Awarded to 20% of degree-seeking students whose GPA averages are the highest for that academic year.

references.name: Jeremy Feinstein
references.reference: Research data scientist and direct supervisor at EVS Argonne.

references.name: Dr. Taran Gujral
references.reference: Associate professor and PI at the Gujral Lab at Fred Hutch, working on systems biology and tackling rare cancers.
